frontmatter.title: Let nature relax and expand space in mind
frontmatter.description: There's never really getting away. We are always with ourselves. Use changes of perspective, surroundings and state wisely.

frontmatter.title: Pause and consider role before responding
frontmatter.description: Pause and consider other perspectives. Ask questions. Determine role and the right way to respond. Better to get it right than rush and assume.

frontmatter.title: Assume good intentions first
frontmatter.description: Like animals and computers, people can be provoked or poorly programmed. That's not generally the default state.

frontmatter.title: Support others by listening and asking guiding questions
frontmatter.description: Take more time to listen to others. They often don't want feedback or advice. They want to share.

frontmatter.title: Identify problems, plan solutions
frontmatter.description: Don't overdo negative talk in any situation, even if it is a "realist" viewpoint. Find positive, keep talks upbeat with others.

frontmatter.title: find joy in the present, there are no perfect conditions
frontmatter.description: There's so much out of our control and no sense hinging joy on uncontrollable. There's something good in everything. Work to find the joy in the present.

frontmatter.title: Stay focused by taking time to reflect, pause, respond
frontmatter.description: It's easy to lose focus when others don't react as expected. Don't let it derail efforts.

frontmatter.title: Building an audience is vital to project success
frontmatter.description: It's not wrong to build an audience - in the physical or digital worlds. It can be looked at as vain and done in the wrong way.

frontmatter.title: Develop a rhythm to generate momentum
frontmatter.description: Wheels don't crash as momentum builds; they keep rolling. Find a rythym to keep rolling and keep from bottoming out.

frontmatter.title: Build credibility by showcasing work and demonstrating value
frontmatter.description: Communicate clearly to help others put themselves in the story.
